Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach with great snorkeling! Room... Not so much!”
Reviews.Author: Gus4321
Reviews.Content: Our room was oceanfront, but it overlooked the luau- not really a bad thing, we were usually in Lahaina, and it was ending when we got home. The first 3 days housekeeping didn't even wash our glasses or coffee cups, but then the staff must have changed, because we had clean cups! The room was run down, but clean. Service at the Royal Lahaina was great, good food in the restaurant with decent prices for Maui! There are two nice pools with a little bar, no icemaker in Ocean Inn, so you have to get your ice from Royal Lahaina-must of the time we just did without! All in all, it was a good value, and I would stay there again. It helped that I read other Tripadvisor reviews, so knew what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: caroline p
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us, its part of a group of hotels next to each other so you get all the "nice" hotel perks without the crazy price. We were upgraded to a new room for free and we loved our stay. This is right on the beach so you can walk right to it from your room. Theres also a great selection of places to eat since youre close to so many hotels. Theres a great one where you can actually eat "on the sand". I would go back here right away and I plan on staying here again the next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap accommodation with all the perks”
Reviews.Author: SandUnderSevenSuns
Reviews.Content: Part of the Royal Lahaina Resort, this is their cheaper accommodation, but I would choose it again over their more expensive accommodation. It is literally right next door and all the facilities of the resort are available to you. It is situated right on the beach and overlooking (if you're lucky) the royal lahaina luau (which is meant to be one of the best). There is a small food store in the resort open til late (11 or 12) I case you need a late night snack or drink. Otherwise there is a couple of shops 5-10 min walk CJ's and a great pizza joint with free wifi (as the resort wifi and Internet is expensive) then another 5-10 min walk is the Whaler's Shopping centre which has heaps of cute shops but still very quaint looking. You could spend your whole holiday in a 1km radius if you wanted to! There is a free shuttle from the resort to Whalers every half hour and a bus to lahaina every half hour is only $1. The dream! The best beaches on the island are Kaanapali, at your door step! Pop your head under the water during the whale season and you can hear them singing, or you can just stand on the beach and see them breaching! We were really happy with this place, basic, clean and probably the best price considering we could use all the resorts facilities, with every thing we needed. A word to the wise though, most restaurants/ eateries close at 8 or 9 so dont leave dinner til the last min like I do. And while the staff are all pleasant, our favourite was the gentleman who drove us to our room in a golf car (taking us on a tour of the resort on our way-sorry we didn't catch his name) and the gorgeous staff working in the activities centre beside the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than most Motel 6's”
Reviews.Author: Melody S
Reviews.Content: My worst Maui hotel experience ever! Very old building looks as if it is slated for demolition soon. Bugs in the bath and kitchen area. Old mattresses (which they did give me a feather bed, which certainly helped). Pesticide and moth ball odors thruout (had to launder everything when I returned home). Paper thin walls, I knew everything my neighbors were up to. Luau every night, which was very very loud. And the most unfortunate is my neighbors key fit my door, on 3 occasions I had someone trying to get into my room, fortunately there was an added security latch. Nothing positive to say except the maid service was exceptional, lovely ladies. I would not recommend this place to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Spade121
Reviews.Content: This is one of the cheapest hotels you will find in Ka'anapali, so you can't expect to get the high end class. We were upgraded to an ocean view room, which was very nice, but not surprisingly, was just near the party area, with a noisy employee party till late evening, the Saturday we arrived and needed the rest, and with early evening daily Lu'au parties. If you like the show, you get it for free from your balcony, minus the food... The great thing about this hotel, is surely it's location, just "on" the beach. two steps out of your room, and you are walking on the beautiful sandy beach. On the downside, a few things to be aware of, and if you don't mind them, you can enjoy a nice vacation in Maui, for an affordable price. 1) Rooms are dated, old style green carpets, and bit shabby bath room area. 2) Mattress is old and not very comfortable. 3) No wireless Internet in rooms, and when in the main resort lobby, Internet beyond one hour is for $10/day. 4) No microwave in the room, which I always found kind of silly, since a cheap microwave costs one third of a single night rate. 5) When we checked in, I got a nice printed paper with the dates of our stay, to put on the dashboard of our car, showing the people in charge that we are eligible to park in the parking area. What they did not bother to tell us, is that we will be charged upon checkout $10/day for this parking. Bottom line - for budget travelers, this is not a bad choice. If you are willing to pay average Maui rates, you can probably do better.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: ayoe6
Reviews.Content: Yea its old, but you are right next to the waves. Staff will make any problem you have right so don't worry. We got the free upgrade to ocean front from ocean view just for asking when we checked in(Thanks whoever suggested that). We were on the top floor and there was a mechanical hum but the sound of the waves cancelled it out. When the hot water went out, they upgraded us to the cottages which were really great. Book this and pray something goes wrong so the great staff can make it right. The tower is worth the extra bucks. Superb location on a great beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever. quaint older hotel, but we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Guy N
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I are in our 40's and we have both travelled a lot. We booked a package at a very low price and I have to admit, I was a little worried about what we would find. We had the absolute best stay ever! The staff at the Royal Lahaina is second to none. they even upgraded us to oceanfront after the first night at no charge. The nicest luau on the island is right there on the property. (we went twice) The entire staff couldn't do enough for us. Much Aloha. on our last day we checked out in the morning and our flight didn't leave until late in the evening. they stored our luggage for us and even provided us with a hospitality room free of charge so we could shower before heading to the airport. We will absolutly be back.

Reviews.Title: “If you need a room while you enjoy Maui...this will do!”
Reviews.Author: citizenkara
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous! right on the beach, north of all the overdevelopment of Kaanapali. The rooms are very 70's, but we had a mini fridge and bought a blender and were all set up! yes, the Luau was right outside, but only from 6-8 pm so not too disruptive, and some areas of the building were more worn than others, but we slept and showered and then were out all day enjoying the island. It was clean, the staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. loved the towel service, the pools were nice. we did have a daily parking fee, but knew that up front. It was part of a Pleasant Holiday package with air and car; I would do it again! we were a minute off the beach, saw every sunrise and sunset for 6 days! if you are easy going, active and out and about, this is totally suitable. ALOHA!

Reviews.Title: “great location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abby E
Reviews.Content: The location is great! Right on the ocean, on the Royal Lahaina Resort property, but the Kaanapali Ocean Inn itself is pretty dumpy. There is no elevator, the rooms are dirty feeling due to the outdated linens & furnishings and the forest green carpet. The bathroom was useable but the shower/toilet combo area was small. The shower itself was just a stand-up and the fixtures all needed re-caulking and the ceiling of the shower was gross. On our 3rd night after being gone all day doing the road to Hana, we came back to find a trail of ants coming from the ceiling to our kitchenette area infesting our not cheap groceries & a dead beetle under the night stand... We immediately called the front desk and they moved us to a cottage still on the Royal Lahaina Resort property (a MUCH nicer place, but the beds seemed the same). Both beds we slept in were very uncomfortable, paper thin pillows and the mattresses were hard, felt like the cheapest ones you could buy. Another downfall was there were no microwaves in any of the rooms. Food in Hawaii is expensive so grocery shopping and trying to do at least 2 meals in your room is really the way to go on a budget so not having a microwave really limited our food options. Another downfall is you have to pay daily for parking, something to keep in mind when looking at other hotels that offer it for free. If you are on a tight budget the Kaanapali Ocean Inn would be suitable because the location is great, if you can spend a little more at least get a cottage or a room at the Royal Lahaina. The pools were great, the restaurant was good & the ocean just feet away made up for the crappy room & ant problem, but I would not recommend this place to a friend unless staying here was their only way of going to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Negative Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bronz01
Reviews.Content: We did a 4-nighter on a special. We had a beautiful room next to the ocean. However, it was also exactly where they hold parties. So, on the very night we really wanted quiet, there was a band on the grass right outside our room for 2+ hours. We talked to the manager about it, but of course, were told when it would be over, and that we'd get breakfast and a prorated credit on our bill. What we wound up with was a "goodwill" deduction memorandum for our next trip. I didn't bother to go through the motions with my credit card company and push for the tangible credit. The staff at the front desk aren't very friendly; though everyone else working there seemed most friendly. If you want a room at the ocean, not terribly costly, and don't mind that there could be a lot of noise at night, then go for it, but there are nicer places at Kaanapali on Maui. As I said, the room was nice, however, the place does need remodeling. Maui is fabulous...Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “1962”
Reviews.Author: flynomore
Reviews.Content: I came for a couple days to attend a wedding at the Royal Lahaina property, which owns the Ocean Inn. I didn't expect a lot since my rate was less than my friends staying next door at the Royal Lahaina. This place was built in 1962 and I think that was the last time anything was done to it. It was clean, but that's all I can say. My room overlooked the back of the bar at the Luau area. The "Free Wireless Internet" turned out to be 1 hour per day, and service kept cutting off. I paid the 10 bucks for all day, but still had very little usage. Staff was ok, they did give us a complimentary room to change in before our evening flight home after checkout. Common areas are shared with the Royal Lahina, which is an ok property, but has very plain pool areas and little other relaxing space for a property of it's size.

Reviews.Title: “If you travel on a budget, look no further!”
Reviews.Author: Lola_Von_Skilet
Reviews.Content: This place isn't the Taj Mahal, but if you are traveling on a budget, this is your place! It's an older hotel surrounded by a great resort with a lot of amenities, which are all available to you. The beach is great and is much less crowded than below Black Rock. If you want luxury, go somewhere else or just don't complain - You get what you pay for! Honestly, your going to Hawaii, much time are you going to be spending inside your hotel room with your eyes open.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Ocean Inn. Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: SweetCakesLA
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were on a budget vacation to Maui, so we chose the Ocean Inn since it's on the property of the Royal Lahaina Resort for a fraction of the cost. We were prepared if it was a dump, we wouldn't be spending much time in the room anyway. The Ocean Inn was a wonderful surprise. The room (1512 on the 2nd floor) was clean, everything worked perfectly. The beds and linens were very comfortable and clean. Amazing view of the ocean from our balcony. I was so shocked to read the poor reviews because our 4 night stay was perfect. Beautiful location. I would recommend this place to friends and look forward to going again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs serious renovation, but......”
Reviews.Author: Michelekor
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the TA reviews are pretty accurate. Here's my two cents: My boyfriend and I (we are in our 60's and 50's, respectively) booked a Pleasant Hawaiian 5 night package with airfare, hotel and rental car for $700 each. Because of the low price, as well as the TA reviews, we didn't have high expectations about our accommodations. Yes, the Ocean Inn is pretty dumpy (toilet didn't flush properly; cottage cheese ceiling had severe water damage; daily charge to use the room safe: $3.75; peeling wallpaper; cockroach bait behind the sofa - and cockroach on railing of lanai). HOWEVER: we asked for and received AT NO EXTRA CHARGE an ocean FRONT room with a sliding glass door that opens onto a small lanai that looks out directly onto Kaanapali Beach, with spectacular sunsets and glorious morning views of the whales breaching in the channel. We also had direct access to the facilities of the Royal Lahaina Resort, which were very nice: great poolside restaurant/bar; ocean activities center with beach towels; poolside lounges; beautiful swimming and snorkeling beach; good parking; helpful and friendly staff - hint: ditch the luau - the entertainment sounded horrible from our balcony). We like to run and swim, so having the ocean at our doorstep as well as the beach walk trail going right through the property was great. We've stayed at other resorts along Kaanapali beach, and I have to say the Ocean Inn was the dumpiest, but it was also, by far, the least expensive, and we hardly spent any time in the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Run down and terrible, ah no guest service!”
Reviews.Author: purpleisle
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the pictures! Notice the main picture is a sketch, and it is not accurate! Picture a smaller, run down building 50 years older. The Knob on the door has an actual key-the key jammed and would not come out-then the whole knob came off! The furniture is outdated in the room, the coffee pot had old coffee in it, the light bulb was burned out on one of the lamps and never got replaced. Housekeeping never replaced the coffee, tea and sugar in the room-we had to ask for it each evening-no garbage bags replaced in room. The pool and beach cabana pictures are off in a different building-they are part of the Royal Lahaina that is on the same property and where you check in, but not were you stay!! Hundreds of feet away from where you stay. If you still decide to stay there, you had better make certain you get ocean front on the 2nd or third floor because at least you have a marvelous view and can hear the ocean, otherwise you will run screaming when your vies is of the bamboo wall dividing the Luau area and the stench of old food and beer wafts into your room! You can also hear the noise through the walls of your adjoining neighbors, and by the way, the adjoining door is NOT secure! And management is condescending and pompous! Gift shops and travel services and free internet where adjoining the Royal Lahaina !

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE SHOULD BE CONDEMED”
Reviews.Author: Sandchick
Reviews.Content: This building needs to be condemed!!!! The bathroom walls were rotting, you could see many places where rain had leaked. It started to downpour, it was raining just as bad thru the celeing in the room as it was outside we used my son's sand buckets to catch the water. Our bed was soaked. They moved us to 2nd floor which smelled so bad of mold & must we gagged. The staff was very friendly and moved us to cottages but the building is unsafe out of the 3 rooms we had all of us had to be moved and even the shower celing fell in the shower in one room. BUGS in room. The resort is beautiful but this building should be tore down before someone gets hurt!!! NOT WORTH THE PRICE TO STAY ITS ROTTEN

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!”
Reviews.Author: stupidID
Reviews.Content: I read mixed reviews about this hotel and decided to try it for myself, knowing that I am not especially picky about where I stay. The dated furnishing did not bother me one bit. What did bother me was how dirty our rooms were. There was mold growing on the wall in the bathroom. There were cobwebs in the corner of the bathroom. The floor felt grimy, both tile and carpet. They left us half a bottle of shampoo/conditioner--I guess they didn't want to throw away what someone else had left. One of our rooms smelled like mold when we walked in. This place is really disgusting. They also charged to use the safe. The staff was not very friendly. Overall, it was just gross. I usually do not get on and write reviews but I had to with this place. I paid $149.00 a night per room plus a $10 a day parking fee. For the money, it was not worth it. I know hotel costs are high in Hawaii, but I've stayed in places in Hawaii that cost the same but were CLEAN and the staff was friendlier. If you're thinking about staying here, don't. On a positive note, it was right on the beach--we did like that!

Reviews.Title: “If you want an upgraded room with an OCEAN view, this could be it.”
Reviews.Author: rcprt
Reviews.Content: We booked our motel and car through Expedia, which were excellent both in the ease of booking and correspondence thereafter. We arrived late and the location was hard to find in the dark. This is probably one of the original motels built here and there are no elevators at this motel should you require one. We walked in and even at first glance one could see the room had literally just been "turned around". The floor was not totally cleaned with cobwebs on the lamp shade and hanging from the ceiling. The bathrooms are turn around tiny with slide doors that hid dead spiders in cobwebs and there were hairs on the floor and in the shower. Ceiling tiles were stained, cracked or missing altogether. Come morning we found the headboard loose from the wall and the dirt and cobwebs behind it were downright scary, indicating one hadn't cleaned for a long time. TV control didn't work and walls are super thin so we heard the several conversations of our neighbors. Many folks were complaining of their rooms, which sounded even worse than ours, and as soon as the upper rooms were vacated they were filled by occupants from the first and second floors. By the sound of the conversations coming from the front decks, people were not happy. The one nice thing was the view from the small front deck - it was wonderful - but a tip when reserving a room...a view room is NOT the same as an OCEAN VIEW.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of potentially harmfull sights.”
Reviews.Author: Rev-C
Reviews.Content: very nice ocean view from room, good king size bed, love seat couch, but missed having an easy chair, room was roomy, adequate dresser space and counter space in bathroom. rooms very run down: carpet not clean, appeared to have black mold along ceiling over bathroom stool, no microwave, holes in patio screen, locks broke on screen door and patio door, cover broke off of air conditioner control, so no way to no what setting one had, out dated unit, but did cool, had to wait for maid to clean room and when we got in bulb was burned out in bathroom. Laundry facilities were not working.

Reviews.Title: “Budget all the way”
Reviews.Author: birdtraveler_11
Reviews.Content: From insect infested dirty rooms to poor service to parking hassles - not recommended. The best thing about it was that the beach was very close but the waves were moderately high due to the slope of the beach, not good for many swimmers. We drove up and parked in front of the check-in area. We were warmly greeted until we mentioned we were staying at Ka'anapali Ocean Inn - then the smiles faded and we were asked to pull to another area to leave the front open for Royal Lahina guests. The service never improved, we were treated like 2nd class citizens everyday.

Reviews.Title: “You should stay here.”
Reviews.Author: GTSP
Reviews.Content: I got an amazing deal from Pleasant Holiday for $499 per person from LA to Maui with airfare and a 3 night stay at Kaanapali Ocean Inn. This hotel has exceeded my expectation. My room on the 3rd floor, 1610, has an ocean view; it is not ocean front but I can hear the surf and see the palm trees and ocean from the bed; it has a high slanted ceiling; the beds are comfortable. It has a coffee maker, a small fridge located in a "minibar" corner with it's own sink, which are amenities I did not expect. When I accidentally broke a knob off the coffee maker, I walked into the hallway to let the housekeeper know; in 10 minutes another coffee maker was delivered to my room....that's service for you.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbug bites”
Reviews.Author: Kameleon_11
Reviews.Content: Kaanapali Ocean Inn hotel is a facility detached from the main hotel-tower. The best and only good thing about it is it's location-right on the beach. It is very old and obviously bedbug infected. One morning we woke up full of bites, itching ourselves for the rest of our stay. We were immediately moved to another room, but the hotel management refused to admit the very obvious thing. Will never come here again!! It was a nightmare not being able to enjoy natural beauty of the island,but itching and scratching all the time!!!! Never happened in our lives!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: BobSt23
Reviews.Content: Being attached to the larger Royal Lahaina Resort, I was expecting lower quality accommodation for the price, especially considering that use of the Royal facilities is included. What I found was a large, clean and comfortable room with everything within easy walking distance. The location is great, with Whalers Village and good restaurants not far away. Very pleased with this hotel. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Choice, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Andrea_027
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kaanapali Ocean Inn (really just a budget section of the Royal Lahaina) from 29 Dec 2010 to 6 Jan 2011. The resort is gorgeous and located on the beautiful Kannapali Beach (the section north of black rock). We stayed in room 1600, a corner room on the third floor with a king sized bed. with our 2 year old son. This room was excellent in that it only received slight (actually pleasant) noise from the nearby luau (which is over at 8:30 anyway). We travelled with older relatives who had room 1511 (middle of second floor, double beds). The luau was incredibly loud from thier room, but again, it is short lived. Room 1600 was a little more attractively appointed in my opinion. The rooms are indeed older and a bit dated but perfectly adequate. Bathrooms do not include tubs, only showers and tend to be damp. (Bathroom was poorly ventilated; there was some mildew stains/water damage. The maids cleaned it every day though.) The rooms were clean, no bugs or other nasties. On the downside, there were no microwaves in either room. We used the coffee maker to boil water for soupcups and had cereal and milk, bread, cheese etc in the fridge for occasional in room meals and managed just fine with our small child. The lanai's do not really have a view of much, just palm trees and some parking lot but were still a relaxing location to read or have a drink in the night time listening to the sounds of ocean waves and tropical birds. You can pay a bit more and get the ocean view in the same building. The wooden railing on the lanai is a bit rickety so take care with small children. The linens were clean and we slept well in the beds. There are stairs rather than elevators. A porter took care of moving our luggage and brought us to our building on a golf cart from the main building reception area. Service was very good and we felt that we were treated equally to those in the main hotel. Everything was close by and a easy walk. The restaurent in the main hotel overlooking the pool was good (a bit pricey, like everything on Maui). Avoid the Castaway Cafe, also located on the resort. Equally high prices but medicore to lousy food and spotty service. Cheap and tasty food can be found at the Lahaina cannery mall food court, by the way. It doesn't look like much, but the Baille asian food stand serves awesome vietnamese Pho and other dishes. The beach is excellent, good swimming, great sunbathing. Nice poolside atmosphere - quiet and relaxed by day with some hawaiian music playing at a low volume from the adjacent restaurent area. Beach towel use is free and we noticed they do occasionally pick up 'abandoned' beach towels to make the lounging chairs available to everyone. A hot tub and small pool is hidden up by the tennis courts (walk through the tennis building). It is open until 9 and rarely in use. The guest makeup seemed to be about 70% couples, 30% families at the time we visited. I can't comment on the nightlife aspect but I'm sure there's plenty of that to be found in Lahaina. No problem to get drinks on the resort to sip by the pool. A small market on the resort sells booze, snacks, diapers and other incidentals but its probably worth a trip to the Lahaina safeway to stock up on food etc when you arrive. Don't forget to pick up a few paper plates/bowls and a packet of plastic cutlery if you are planning on eating some meals in the room. There are also some on-resort shops selling a good selection of aloha clothing (not too overpriced) and souvineers. An ice cream parlour is also located on the resort. A nice treat for the whole family on a hot day. A poolside stand sells floats, balls etc for kids to use in the pool (reasonably priced) plus a more expensive line of skin care products and sun glasses etc for the adults. The Royal Lahaina Luau takes place on the property. The entrtainment sounded poor compared to the two others we have been to on Maui. Don't bother with it unless you get a really cheap deal. Overall, for location and price this place can't be beat. All the benefits of a beautiful well located beachfront resort without the high price tag. The room is budget but clean and functional. We've previously been to Maui and stayed at the Hotel Wailea, which was also a decent budget choice though not directly on the beach. The rooms at that hotel were proper suites with full bathroom and kitchen area. I'd suggest a rental car for any trip to Maui, especially if your hotel is not beachfront. There are so many incredible things to see and do on this amazing island. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Maui vacation on a budget (especially with little kids)”
Reviews.Author: BSMet94
Reviews.Content: Here's the basics: The Kaanapali Ocean Inn is not a stand-alone hotel. It's a 3-story motel-type building containing the cheap rooms, and part of the Royal Lahaina Resort complex. Apart from the cheap room, travelers staying at the Kaanapali Ocean Inn are treated no differently than any other Resort guest. There is no lobby or other facility in this building, just rooms. All check-in and other services are in the main lobby of the RLR tower. The Kaanapali Ocean Inn building was built in the early 60s and basically nothing has been done to the facility since. And I do mean nothing. I'm pretty sure it's the same 1962 bathroom tile/fixtures, furniture, and hardware. When was the last time you stayed at a hotel that still used actual metal keys that you put on your key ring? They keys thing might scare some people from a safety standpoint, but remember that hotels and commercial buildings usually use key types that you can't just run to Home Depot and get a copy made. Probably they've changed the carpets and bedding/mattresses a few times over they years by necessity, but that's it. They keep the rooms and hallways as clean as possible. As far as I could see, only the 2nd and 3rd floor rooms and possibly the 4 ground floor rooms facing the ocean are occupied by guests. The other ground floor rooms appear to be used as storage, and two of them serve as bathrooms for the nightly Luau. The best part about this place after the price is the proximity to the beach. So if you have small kids and plan on spending a lot of time at the beach, with frequent bathroom/diaper change trips back to the room, this is extremely convenient, and you won't feel bad about going back and forth because you're basically going direct beach-to-room and not having to go through a lobby or anything. Rooms on the South side of the building will hear the nightly Luau goings on (over and quiet well before 9:00 PM, so not a huge annoyance). The ocean facing rooms have an awesome view, particulaly the 3rd floor. The North side rooms are the quietest. Some of the rooms (not all) have a sink and small refridgerator in the room. One other tip: happy hour at the restaurant/bar by the main pool and the tiki bar by the other pool is 2:00 to 6:00 PM, mai-tais are $5.00, and if the tiki bar is closed for some reason, the main bar will put the drink in a plastic cup to go (to the pool, back to your room, or to the beach). In summary, if you're going to Maui on a budget, this is the best place. If you plan to spend most of your time sight-seeing, relaxing on the beach, or other activities (and there are thousands), and you want to focus your time/money on enjoying yourself outside the hotel room, this is your place. Also, be assured that your room will be clean, and if you have a problem the resort staff will treat you well, and will do their best to address your issue as a resort guest (with no prejudice just because you're staying in the cheap part of the resort). Also, if you're interested, and if they have space, they will offer you an upgrade to one of the cottages. Just ask when you check in. Sometimes the upgrade is free, sometimes it's an additional charge, but always less than what you would have paid by booking a cottage room to begin with.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and information.”
Reviews.Author: rfherrell
Reviews.Content: We were at the Ocean Inn for 2 weeks, Dec 1-15th got an ocean front first floor room that was worn and outdated, asked and received another ocean front room on the 2nd floor which was much better and newer furnishings. If possible get a ocean side room on the 2nd or 3rd floor, we were in room 1524, had a great view, on the side away from the lula, the lula gets a little old after a couple of nites, can go out front near the ocean and watch it for free. Your are only about 50 ft from the ocean with a easy walk from your room. The service was great, can use all the facilities of Royal Lahaina, has a great tennis facility, also a small hot tub near the tennis courts that is not used very often. Food, CJ's Deli is real close to the Inn, has excellent food that is very reasonable. The ocean view from our room was outstanding, went on an early morning whale watch with Pacific Whale Foundation from pier 3 at Lahina, saw about 6 humpback whales, put on a show, saw about 30 breaches and some trumpenting. We booked through Pleasant Vacation's, sponsored by AAA Auto, for a mid size car, 14 days at Ocean Inn, and air fare from Nashville, TN to Kahauli Airport in Maui for less than 2800.00. Don't expect the Ritz, the view is excellent, service is very good, has only a small refrigirator, no microwave, this was our 3rd trip to maui. Randy & Faith Winchester, TN

Reviews.Title: “A Dump”
Reviews.Author: JRHDenver
Reviews.Content: Although I expected an old, run down, not updated or maintained property, it exceeded (negatively) my expectations. Maid service was inconsistent, wifi in the main resort unreliable, the front desk not helpful, the guest laundry "closed for renovation", Don the Beachcomber not open, the Barefoot Bar not open, etc. In short the Royal Lahaina Resort (of which the Kaanapali is a part) looked like they were cutting every corner possible. There must be at least a thousand better places on Maui to stay. Oh, and as for their Luau, very tacky!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: Indiancraig
Reviews.Content: If you want to experiance the flavor of the island - this is the place - from the "welcome home" as you enter to Ahola every time you see someone - visited to give my daughter away in a beach front wedding - what you didn't have in furnishings you more than made up with in service and welcome - I happen to work as an EC member at a 4 diamond resort in Puerto Rico and would love to have your staff. Simple, welcoming, and sincere - what else do you need -

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kashka70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from October 19 - 26, 2010. Upon arrival we were upgraded from Garden View to Ocean Front (this was our anniversary). The location was excellent. Having access to all the resort amenities was great. We had buffet breakfast twice and it was very filling and a lot of choices. We also enjoyed dinner while watching sunset. The beach was never crowded. First three nights we stayed out on the beach until 1am and enjoyed swimming in warm water. Weather was great during our stay. It rained for about an hour and for us it was nothing (we are from Vancouver, BC). The housekeeping was great. I just feel sorry for them cleaning all the sand, since we are so close to the beach. We're checking flights for our stay in September 2011, this time for 10 days as it was hard to leave from such a beautiful and peaceful place. Thank you for your hospitality. Kashka PS. Elenore we'll see you in September

Reviews.Title: “Kaanipali Ocean Pit”
Reviews.Author: Galapagos_hombre
Reviews.Content: This place is a throw back from the 50s and I don't think it has been updated since then. Close, real close to the beach but there is no way this place should qualify as a two stars. Motel 6 is a upgrade. Sad, because the first impression one gets from the security guard and the front desk is very positive and welcoming but then you have to go your room at some point. There weren't any bugs but the bathroom was a little scary and the particle board cabinets were falling apart.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: LeLuIowa
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research before booking this hotel. We were told the decor was outdated, but the hotel was clean and the staff friendly. That is correct! I travel a lot for business and gross out easily when it comes to hotel rooms. I didn't have any freak out moments the entire week :) My husband and I loved that the beach was just steps away and we had access to all of the resort amenities. We took one of the free pilates classes offered. It was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “This would be the greatest hotel if...”
Reviews.Author: Ondrej_Pavla
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be the greates if renovated and with new housekeeping staff. The room was spacious but very used. A lot of things needs to be renovated here. If renovated, the hotel would be very very nice!!! But what the hotel requires even more is to fire the present housekeeping staff - they are really bad at doing their job. Really bad. Our room had not been vacuum cleaned properly for a very long time when we got there (e.g. behind the TV) and the hallway did not look clean at all. The staff at the front desk was, however, great! Very nice and very helpful. And they are honest with you (about what to do in Hawaii and how to do it not in the mos expensive way).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fine hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: SafireDragon
Reviews.Content: I gave this hotel 5 stars because of the amazing value. I got a very, very good deal on this hotel and was not expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the inn is old and the rooms are a bit dated. But I did not find them at all unpleasant, and I had a balcony with an ocean view and could hear the waves in my room at night. The beach was a very quick walk and Kaanapali beach is just wonderful to spend the day on. Also, I had full access to all that the Royal Lahaina Resort had to offer, including it's 2 nice pools, shops, tiki lounge, and restaurants. I was able to watch the resort's Luau show (which I would not pay the asking price for) from the stairs of the inn. There was a small amount of mildew in the bathroom, but I did not notice any odor, and I'm very sensitive to smells. Overall, this Inn is an exceptional value with a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay AWAY!! STAY FAR AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: isdocha
Reviews.Content: Room with a smell and bad customer service! Arrived late Saturday, Aug. 7th. Upon checking in they escorted us to our room in the "other building" Kaanapali Ocean Inn managed by the Royal Lahaina Resort (the tower) Pictures are VERY decieving... building needs to be torn down! If they cared about their customers and reputation, they would not rent these rooms. When we entered the room, we were overwhelmed by the musty, mildew smell. Upon complaining to the front desk I was told, "you got what you paid for" by Management. If I had known I was paying for a dump I wouldn't have bought it! Furnishings, linens, overall decor from the 70's. There were holes and dirt on the walls. The bathrooms were mildewed and water damaged. We were offered to view 2 other rooms in the Kaanapali building, each in the same condition... no improvements. I offered to pay for an upgraded room to the tower, but was told no, they were sold out. When we checked on line later there showed some available. Our friends had made prior arrangements for their Luau dinner, also a BIG disappointment. Not worth the $50 we were charged, which I was told was their discounted price. Cheap buffet, mediocre presentation and commercial/corney dance. DON"T put your money here! The tower rooms I am sure are better, but based on the customer service we recieved I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: redryderbkr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated part of our 25th anniversary at the Kaanapali Ocean Inn and right from the time we arrived on the property to check in, which is at the Royal Lahaina Resort, we were treated with the best of service. Even though we were staying at the budget minded "Inn" we were treated as "Resort" guests. Our room, although dated was more than adequate. It was clean and comfortable. The balcony had one of the best beach and ocean front views we experienced while in Hawaii with sunsets to die for. We both remarked how fortunate we were to have chosen the Kaanapali Ocean Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Marine turtles on site!”
Reviews.Author: c0nquistad0r
Reviews.Content: Aloha! We stayed at this resort which happens to be part of the Royal Lahaina Resorts and is also next the LUAU. We really enjoyed our stay here for 5 nights. The key things were the fact that the beach was right there no need to walk that much and there were places close by to eat. We ordered out from The Table pizza place it was really good, and also ate at the China Bowl which was good as well. We didnâ€™t go the terrace at all but did go the Cast away cafe the food quality was very great. Snorkeling was at the Black Rock in front of Sheraton, maybe 15min or so and your were there. Its best to go early when its not that full of people around so u have better visibility plus water current is less strong. They do have many assorted fish and its quite neat but be careful with getting pulled away from the shore wear your fins and if possible some floating device too. We had the opportunity to snorkel while a huge marine turtle was eating on the side of the Royal Lanaina Resort just by where the beach shore ends. We took a cab to Lahaina Town and it was very nice since they have many local artist on the main street with beautiful exhibits, there are also many shops and places to have decent lunch or dinner. Try the famous shaved ice you choose your flavor. Donâ€™t forget to eat Mauiâ€™s Golden Pineapple. Just so you are not surprised the cab trip from the resort is an average of $15 per way. As far as souvenirâ€™s go you will need to shop around since prices are up there. We purchased some Tiki art work from a local artist for a decent price. Overall we would recommend this resort our Maui to anyone who is looking to get away and have a relaxing adventurous vacation at a Dream location! Not good if you want luxury updated room etc... just go to the Royal Lahaina or Sheraton or some other place this location is great if you are not looking to spend a lot but do want to have a great time if your have any questions feel free to email me Mahalo P.S go to a local market and purchase beverages maybe jam and cheese for sandwiches you do have a mini fridge to put them in and they also have an ice machine.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe some of these reviews!”
Reviews.Author: NealSil
Reviews.Content: OK. Some of these reviews almost scared me away. I decided to take a chance since we were only coming over to Maui for a quick trip from Oahu. First, this is not a 5 star resort. That being said, we had a fantastic time here with my wife, Cousin, and his wife. When we arrived, there was a person monitoring the comings and goings of folks. They checked a clip board and said "Welcome Home Mr. Silva". Check in was a breeze and we went to a very cute room that was in sort of a 4 plex. Our room was older but everything worked. We had a lanai with a beautifull view of a Banyan tree. I could not believe the price. < 100 bucks a night! We got unpacked and headed to the pool. We discovered there were 2 pools. We liked the one with the poolside bar. We set up our lounge chairs facing the ocean and proceded to drinking happy hour Mai Tai's. I can't remember (good sign?) how much the drinks were but I think the range waas $2.50 to $4.00. We pretty much did not move more than 300 feet the next 6 hours. Back to the room, dressed for dinner and headed to Lahaina (about 5-10 minutes). Returned at 9pm, was greeted "Welcome Home Mr. Silva" and headed back to the room. BTW, These rooms were quiet. Could not hear anything except tropical birds. Great night sleep. The next morning we had breakfast near the second pool seated outside. They had a wonderful menu but I chose the buffett which had a wide assortment of breakfast items including Portuguese Sausage. It might have cost $11 or $12. It was a deal! Anyway, the visit was just fine. On check out day my Cousin and I wanted to head to Waimea but the girls wanted to stay by the pool. We checked with the front desk and they said they would provide a room for showers when the girls were ready to leave. They made an appointment for 5pm and got an entire extra day by the pool. In summary, I thought this place was great! My Cousin and I both picked up brochures for the next trip. They are planning on staying here for an entire 2 weeks in 2010. Don't be afraid of the place based on some of these reviews. We saw 4 rooms and they were just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome location on a budget”
Reviews.Author: gadgetman13
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with all the other reviewers who caution that this is for the budget-minded. The location is excellent, the reef off the beach are excellent for snorkeling. The rooms are definitely for the budget-minded considering the other hotels/resorts surrounding it. But, if you're on a budget and don't mind slightly outdated accommodations I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “WHO CAN BEAT 4 DAYS STAY TO MAUI FOR UNDER $500 PLUS CAR AND FLIGTH"”
Reviews.Author: cakungmo
Reviews.Content: I booked through pleasant holidays. My intention of the trip was to bring all 6 of my family member to Maui without breaking a budget. Here is the deal about the Hotel. if you stay make sure you stay n the 2nd or 3rd floor only, facing the ocean. Where can you find a place under 500 dollar facing the ocean. The beach and the building it self is only 150 small steps. For our family is was very convenient because the beach is right there. Second thing I like about this place. There is a nice place to go snorkeling about 1/2 mile. you can walk to the spot which is by the BLACK ROCK on the left side of the hotel. The 3rd i like about this place if you book your hotel on number 1620 or 1621 0r 1622 you can actually see the LUOA from your balcony. get your self food to go from the local supermarket get a chair and watch the show from your balcony. will save you 87 dollar. Overall this place is only for BUDGETED PEOPLE if you have money to spend thousand and thousand go ahead but for me I spend $2785.00 USD for 6 people that included Flight form LA to Maui, Car rental for 5 days and 3 hotel rooms. We enjoyed our stay at the kaanapali ocean inn.

Reviews.Title: “Budget-Friendly Beach Front Property”
Reviews.Author: VJEN888
Reviews.Content: Like most other reviewers, the warning IS that this property is definitely for the budget minded traveler who does not mind some outdated decor and lack of elevator. With that said, the building is only 3 stories tall and the stairs weren't that difficult. If this Hawaiian trip is a "big" trip for you, then I may not recommend the hotel for you since people tend to like to splurge on accommodations for rare trips. For us, we travel so frequently, and Hawaii is a quick flight and easy for us so the budget part is perfect for us. The Kaanapali Ocean Inn was part of our Pleasant Holidays package. We were on the 3rd floor and had nice ocean view - opposite side of the luau, but one the line for the luau side. Thankfully we were never in the room much during luau time. And if you are in Maui - why would you be in your room during those hours? You should be out enjoying the ocean and sunsets. Pros: * The Kaanapali Ocean Inn is on the actual property of the Royal Lahaina. Full se of all its amenities and mostly private beach. We liked the seclusion of this property in contrast to most of those on the Beachwalk. * It is very easy to walk to the connecting Beachwalk where most restaurants and other hotels are. There is also a free Kaanapali shuttle to take you into the Whaler's Village/Beachwalk. * The hotel room itself was very clean and spacious. * More chance of getting ocean views in your room than the Royal Lahaina "cottages". Cons: * Outdated decor. * The bathroom door on a hinge is kind of weird and again, outdated. * Standing shower only, no tub. Not a big deal to us, but I know a lot of people mind. * No elevator. If this bothers you, I would request a 1st or 2nd floor room. * There is a mandatory $10/day parking fee even if you don't have a car. But mostly everyone rents a car in Maui. Consensus: We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family that don't mind the slightly outdated decor. If you're looking to be pampered in luxury though, I'd definitely recommend The Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room for a Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Jezaka81
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for our Honeymoon in April. We thought it was a perfect place for us. It was very quiet and ALL of the staff were VERY nice. When we checked in we were actually upgraded to an ocean view room at no extra charge!! The hotel is a bit older and some what out of date on the outside, but we did not go to Maui to stay in our hotel room, it was pretty much a place to sleep and store our stuff. The views are great and there is a Luau held at the resort every night besides Saturdays, which is a very nice show with REALLY good food. If you're looking for something high end, this hotel wouldnt be it, but if you are looking to save money and have fun STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Never, never, never, ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Town_Country
Reviews.Content: This place is really for budget travelers. It's like a motel for truck drivers. I would give it a zero if that was an option. We arrived at the Royal Lahaina and checked in thinking it might be decent. They gave us real keys. That should have been a sign. Only old dingy hotels still use these kind of locks. Anyways, the walk over to the stairs were right next to the Luau/Bar. So the old alcohol stank still lingered. We finally get to our room and walked in. First thing I noticed was the old dog urine smell of the place. I took off my slippers and walked around the room and noticed that the carpet was still wet. Not sure if they just cleaned it or there's water running from the sink onto the carpet. They didn't have any king size beds available, so we were given 2 queens. The covers looked very old & dingy and I felt dirty just looking at it. I figure, I've been in worst locations when I was younger. I went into the restroom and the there was mold on the shower tiles and rust in the exhaust fan grill. The shower felt like an old high school gym shower. After seeing all this, I convince myself that the only time I will be in the room is to sleep, so that shouldn't be too bad. So we leave and take our little road trip around the west side of the island. I recommend everyone taking this drive and stopping in this small town to buy banana bread. There's this friendly Hawaiian fella that sells them out of a small stand. Sorry, I don't know the name of the town, but you can't miss it. 2 loaves for $10 is not bad, since they are bigger than most. And did I mention still moist and good 3 days later. Great breakfast item. Anyways, by the time we came back from our trip, it was late and we came back to the room. Very disappointed!!! I couldn't believe that after that nice drive, I have to come home to this. So, I called the front desk and asked them to move me to one of the suites at the Royal Lahaina. The price would have been $100 per night for the upgrade, but the front desk worker gave it to us for $50 a night. I took it in a heartbeat. When we got into the suite, it really felt like a vacation. It was immaculate. The view could have been better, but the room made up for it. The rooms at the Royal Lahaina have gone through a very expensive upgrade. Before I end this babble of mine, ask yourself this, you spend 1 year working hard for your money and look forward to a nice relaxing vacation on a tropical island. Don't be cheap. After experiencing the beautiful island and a long drive to Hana, you want to come back to a nice room and just veg out. Don't skimp on the room. It's well worth it. Just think, you can save money and stay in a horrible motel or treat yourself a little for your hard work and stay in a nice hotel. Believe me, it will make your vacation more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Option!”
Reviews.Author: Islandhop_cg
Reviews.Content: Here is the scoop on this place. The Kaanopali Ocean Inn is actually closed (for remodeling/refurnishing I think). Because it is in accessible, your reservation goes through the Royal Lahaina Resort (owned by same people, located right next store). We checked in at the Royal Lahaina resort and the man said that we were upgraded (because Kaanapali Ocean Inn is not usable). You can be upgraded to the "cottages" or, in our case, we were upgraded to stay in the Royal Lahaina Resor tower - ocean view room! We made a reservation for under $100 per night. This was an incredible gift to us. So - All that to say - make a reservation here are you will be upgraded and get more than you pay for!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Try this option...”
Reviews.Author: Delfuego
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Kaanapali Ocean Inn and when I checked in I asked to be upgraded. Which they did, and put me in the Royal Lahaina town with an ocean view room, Those rooms go for $379. I only paid $174 per night for the KOI. The Kaanapali Ocean Inn looked addequit. I even peeked in a room and it looked clean. And the property is very close to the water. I think it's worth the shot.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: kiheikitty
Reviews.Content: When we arrived there they didn't have 2 double beds that we requested so they gave us a King size bed and a roll-away bed for my friend. Our room was right next to the Luau stage so every night we got to watch the show. Every morning my friend ran on the beach and my husband and I slept in. On the last night of our trip we bought some chip, salsa, cheese, and beer and enjoyed the luau entertainment. The price was not bad. If I was staying for a week I would have been able to recite the entire luau show for you. The bathroom that we had was handicapped assessable which is nice if you have a disability. After reading some of the reports here I was a bit worried but all in all it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “great views from clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: wholelottaworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in june this year and although the hotel is really in need of a facelift, decoration wise, it is a good value hotel compared to others in the area. The location is ideal, at the quiet end of Kanaapali beach and you can use all of the facilities of the Royal Lahaina hotel which is right next to the Ocean Inn. The rooms were extremely spacious and the bed linen was really clean and the bed comfy. We weere on the second floor and there was no lift so this could pose a problem for those with walking difficulties. We had a view of the car park from our balcony but spent very little time in the room so this was not a problem. There was a coffee maker and refrigerator in the room which came in handy if you wanted a hot coffee or tea late at night or early morning or a cold beer. If you are looking for a budget hotel with a really great location set right on the beach this hotel is for you. The poor decor is a small price to pay for the most stunning breathtaking scenery all around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OCEANFRONT ONLY at the Kaanapali OCEAN INN”
Reviews.Author: adelais1
Reviews.Content: My cousins were staying at the Royal Lahaina and invited us over from Oahu for a night. We flew in, drove a convertable over and planned on spending one night and attending the Luau (slightly cheesy but alot of laughs and the pork is unreal) and visiting Front street and Maui and spending time with my family who live in Santa Barabara. I am from Virginia Beach and was traveling with two young adults and a seven year old. I am a very picky traveler when it comes to hotels but my cousin was very generous and was picking up the tab for the room and booked us in ocean view---two queen beds. I thought I would be staying at the Royal Lahaina. We came over last minute and this was the only room available on the property. The popcorn ceiling was falling apart and the bathroom had mold and mildew. This is not a room to stay in if you have asthma or allergies. The hotel is really really dirty (cobwebs in the hallway) and half of the rooms look out on the luau (yikes)--but you could watch it for free....ha ha ...there is a smell of warm trash in a dumpster as you walk in the place. The doors to the rooms and the balconys are old and dirty. The shower head sprayed water up on the ceiling which made big drops of condensation that landed back on your head as you showered and the shampoo was horrible----tangle shampoo. The shower experience was the worst--I should have just rinsed off at the pool. Our ocean view looked over private massage tables and the line for the luau. Imagine a line of luau goers outside your room as you get ready. Our balcony was old and the railing wiggled. My cousin called the front desk (he is picky too) and we were upgraded to the ocean view--which had a nice clean ceiling, normal shower (small) and okay beds. (hampton inn blows these beds away) and slightly upgraded shampoo. The room was cleaner also. I opened the door and the view and the sounds of the ocean at your bedside did make sleeping a dream. So for oceanfront sleeping in Maui this was not a bad nights rest. (The door was off the track mind you)..... This is not the Royal Lahaina--but a good deal for a night or two--my time at the resort with my cousin and in town was really fun and I am glad I was upgraded to the nicer room. However, if you are on a honeymoon or something special stay at the Royal Lahaina instead, Those rooms (oceanfront) are really nice. They have wonderful upgrades to make you feel special. My cousins did that on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: e90
Reviews.Content: We were extremely dissapointed with this hotel. Here's the worst of it: there were cockroaches in the rooms, the ceiling was shedding dust/debris, the shower was moldy and the shower head was about 4ft off the ground. Also, the sheets were very scratchy. I should qualify this review by mentioning we stayed at the garden terrace (2 story structure), not the tower -- I have no idea if the tower is any better. We complained to Hotwire since this hotel was at the time considered 4-star, according to their ratings, which wasn't even close. I'd say 1 star, assumming no cockroaches. If you have ever used bidding sites like Hotwire you know that the star rating is extremely important, as the rating, price and location is the only information you have beforehand. Btw, Hotwire didn't do anything for us except issue lame apoligies -- I will never use Hotwire ever again. The hotel staff did replace the bed sheets after we complained, which was nice. Also the breakfast was actually quite decent.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Itzabitsy
Reviews.Content: For $175 a night the Kaanapali Ocean Inn was just ok. Everyday I called the front desk @ Royal Lahaina because none of our keys would open the door properly. After 3 days of fighting with it, I was glad to be on my way to Oahu. This is owned by The Royal Lahaina and everything is very expensive. We ate next door at the Castaway Cafe which sits on the Maui Kaanapali Villas property. A very nice condo which is where I will stay at next time. Everyone we talked to loved it there. Very frendly people work there and food and beverages are alot cheaper. A tropical drink is $2 less for example. Visit the village of LaHaina down by the boat harbor and do some shopping. You can also buy a boat tour to do some whale watching. The whales are in Hawaii January-March to give birth. Alot of shops and eating is good there also. The road to Hana was alot of winding roads and is pretty but the road was closed coming around the other side so we had to go back the same way. My teenage kids were both car sick. I would check on the roads first before you drive it. Allow yourself extra driving time from Kahului airport to the Kaanapoli Beach are. Traffic gets pretty heavy. Otherwise Maui has beautiful golf courses.

HotelInfo.Name: Kaanapali Ocean Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 2780-A Kekaa Drive, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
